column1: You are at risk for low blood sugar if you have diabetes and are taking any of the following diabetes medications: - Insulin - Glyburide (Micronase), glipizide (Glucotrol), glimepiride (Amaryl), repaglinide (Prandin), or nateglinide (Starlix) - Chlorpropamide (Diabinese), tolazamide (Tolinase), acetohexamide (Dymelor), or tolbutamide (Orinase)
People who have low blood sugar need to check their blood sugar more often.
- How to inject glucagon, a hormone that increases your blood sugar.
This helps emergency medical workers know you have diabetes.
